panels.description: Percentage of requests that are served from either the pack cache or repo cache without pulling additional data from the upstream
panels.title: Cache Hit Ratio

panels.description: Total data fetched from the upstream to populate the local repo cache.
panels.title: Fetched from upstream
Data served (total over current time range)
Requests Served (total over current time range)

panels.description: Total data sent responding to un-cacheable requests. The gitCDN cache is immediately consistent, and does not attempt to cache any requests that are not POST /git-upload-pack requests.
panels.title: Un-cacheable Responses
Total Git Traffic Served by cache instance

panels.description: The pack cache contains fully-cached git-upload-pack responses. Pack cache misses are served from the repo cache, then added to the pack cache. Responses which can not be cached (like GET info/refs) are shown here as N/A.
panels.title: Pack Cache Hit/Miss Bandwidth
Cache Filesystem Disk Usage Over Time

panels.description: Number of objects evicted from the pack cache. Objects are (theoretically) evicted in a least-recently-used manner.
panels.title: Pack cache evicted objects

panels.description: Amount of data evicted from the pack cache as a result of the cache filling up. Least recently used data is evicted first.
panels.title: Pack cache evicted space
